## GAD-7 vs BITSEA

The field of psychology often requires researchers to make in-depth comparisons between various questionnaires for more inclusive and comparative studies. One such comparison is between the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and Brief Infant Toddler Emotional Assessment (BITSEA). The comparison or harmonisation of GAD-7 vs BITSEA can be challenging as it involves the matching of items across these questionnaires, a process that is both time-consuming and subjective. However, the Harmony software significantly eases this process. Using cutting-edge natural language processing and generative AI models, Harmony can aid researchers in harmonising questionnaire items across different languages. Comparing 'GAD-7 vs BITSEA' becomes not only precise but also efficient with Harmony. It offers a database of instruments to choose from or allows researchers to drag and drop their own instruments in PDF format into Harmony's user-friendly web interface. In essence, "GAD-7 vs BITSEA" is a typical comparative scenario that psychologists and social scientists may frequently encounter. With Harmony software, they can not only expedite the harmonisation process but also implement it across different languages, enhancing the comprehensiveness of their studies. Incorporating these AI-based tools in research processes can make the task of psychologists easier, accurate, and more productive.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and BITSEA

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#_In1dfV0=" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and BITSEA into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#_In1dfV0=" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#_In1dfV0=" target="harmonyapp">Import just BITSEA into Harmony</a> - compare BITSEA with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
